alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 9:55PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kit Carson and southwestern Sherman Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 855 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Burlington. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Kit Carson and southwestern Sherman Counties. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 433 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 172 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
